listings.bat_description: This 2022 Porsche 911 Carrera S coupe was purchased by the seller in February 2024 for use during special occasions, and it has 9k miles. The car was specified in GT Silver Metallic over a black leather interior with climatized Sport Plus front seats, and it was additionally optioned with the Sport and Sport Chrono Packages, a front-axle lift system, rear-axle steering, Power Steering Plus, an extended-range fuel tank, 20″ and 21″ RS Spyder Design wheels, Lane Change Assist, Surround View, a Bose sound system,  and Porsche Dynamic Light System Plus (PDLS+). Power comes from a twin-turbocharged 3.0L flat-six mated to an eight-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle. This 992.1 S coupe is now offered with an options sheet, the owner’s manual, a CTEK battery maintainer, a clean Carfax report, and a Texas title in the seller’s name.The car is finished in GT Silver Metallic (M7Z) with SportDesign side skirts and Porsche side graphics. Features include a glass sunroof, Porsche Dynamic Ligh

listings.bat_description: This 1997 Porsche 911 is a triple-black Carrera 4 cabriolet powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six that drives all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes 17″ Cup II wheels, a power-operated soft top, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and a “basket handle” fixed rear spoiler in addition to supple leather upholstery, power-adjustable front seats, a Becker-Porsche CD stereo, cruise control, and air conditioning. The car was acquired by the current owner in 2024, and work in preparation for the sale involved replacing the tires and changing the oil. This 993 C4 cabriolet is now offered with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the name of the seller’s trust.The car is finished in black and was fitted with a replacement power-retractable black soft top in 2014, while the drive cables for the top were replaced in 2018. Additional details include headlight washers, heated power-adjustable mirrors, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a “basket han

listings.bat_location: and an April 2023 entry lists further damage
listings.bat_description: Sep 22 at 7:30 AMUSD $1,200 bid placed byAtc725Sep 22 at 1:34 AMUSD $911 bid placed byZoltzManiacSep 21 at 5:05 PMKsm144 (The Seller)This author's likes:38In regards to the damage reported – I don’t have knowledge of the first incident as that was prior ownership and I purchased the car from a dealer who could not give any details other than what is in Carfax.  I believe that is when the GT2 conversion was added as it involved the rear bumper.  The second incident  was with me when I took the vehicle for car alignment and when I brought it back home noticed a significant ding in the passenger door. I initially thought the car was keyed but believe it happened when the technician was working on the car. I filed an insurance claim to have that corrected along with other paint imperfections around the car too include the lower side skirts as I did not like the GT2 side skirts – makes the car look bulky.  Side skirts do come with the vehicle if the new owner wants to reinstall them. I do h

listings.bat_description: This 2006 Porsche 911 Carrera S coupe is powered by a 3.8-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic over gray Natural leather. Equipment includes the Leather Package, the Power Seat Package, the Sport Chrono Package Plus, 19″ Carrera S wheels, Fabspeed exhaust components, a deployable rear spoiler, bi-xenon headlights, a sunroof, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation as well as heated adaptive sport seats, automatic climate control, and cruise control. The car has 77k miles following history in Florida. This 997.1 C2S coupe is now offered in Florida by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual and a clean Montana title.The car is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic (92U) and features a power sunroof, a speed-activated rear spoiler, bi-xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and quad exhaust outlets. A June 2016 entry in the Carfax report notes that the car was involved in a rear-end collision w

listings.bat_description: This 2000 Porsche 911 Carrera is a Canadian-market coupe that has been modified with an LN Engineering deep-sump oil pan kit, a dual oil catch can system, and Rennline solid engine mounts for its 3.4-liter M96 flat-six, while mount inserts for the six-speed manual transaxle are equipped. The suspension and braking systems utilize Scale Alpine Series coilovers, front and rear Eibach sway bars, an upgraded 996 GT3-style brake master cylinder, 330×28mm 991 Carrera-sourced front rotors with 996.1-style calipers, 996 GT3-sourced front brake air ducts, Meyle Track control arms, and stainless-steel brake lines. The exhaust system has a GT3-style muffler bypass and Beluga tailpipes, and a Martini-style livery covers the Arctic Silver Metallic-finished bodywork, which has been fitted with Aerokit-style components. Inside, the Black partial leather-trimmed cabin has a RUF short-shift kit, a Rennline left-front aluminum floor cover, Rennline aluminum pedals, and an Alcantara-wrapped steering whee

listings.bat_location: Log
listings.bat_description: This 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera Targa was initially sold by Stead Motors of Walnut Creek, California, and acquired by the seller from the original owneron BaT in January 2020. The car now has 40k miles, and it is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a four-speed Tiptronic transaxle. The Arctic Silver Metallic exterior is complemented by black leather cabin upholstery, and equipment includes 17″ two-piece Targa wheels, a power-operated glass roof panel, a speed-activated rear spoiler, an immobilizer defeat device, cruise control, air conditioning, and a Classic head unit with Porsche Communication Management (PCM) operation. This 993 Targa is now offered with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, spare parts, a car bra and cover, and a clean Wisconsin title in the seller’s name.The 993 Targa was based on the convertible bodyshell and featured a revised roof with a lifting and sliding glass center section as opposed to the removable top found on earlier 911 Targa mo

listings.bat_location: a trunk-mounted CD changer
listings.bat_description: This 2002 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.6L flat-six that drives all four wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle, and it is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic over a black full leather interior. A Porsche Classic Communication Management infotainment system has been added, and the car is also equipped with a speed-activated rear spoiler, a sunroof, xenon headlights, integrated fog lights, 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, cruise control, an onboard computer, and automatic climate control. This 996 Turbo coupe has 22k miles following registration history in Alabama and Florida, and it is now offered with a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.The car is finished in Arctic Silver Metallic (L92U), and features include a sunroof, xenon headlights, fog lights, a rear window wiper, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and stainless steel exhaust outlets as well as wider rear bodywork, rear air intakes, and revised bumper covers in comparison to the contemporary Carrera. listings.bat_location: your existing pre-authorization will be released
listings.bat_description: This Canadian-market 1997 Porsche 911 Carrera S coupe is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Guards Red over black leather upholstery. Equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 18″ hollow-spoke “Technology” wheels, a power-operated sunroof, power-adjustable front sport seats, a cassette stereo, a remote six-disc CD changer, cruise control, and air conditioning. The car was acquired by the selling dealer in 2025, and work performed in preparation for the sale is said to have included refinishing the wheels, front lower control arms, the transmission selector shaft seal, and shifter bushings. This 993 C2S now shows 67k kilometers (~42k miles) and is offered in Canada with manufacturer’s literature, service records, clean US and Canadian Carfax reports, and British Columbia registration.The 993 C2S featured wider bodywork, a split rear grille, and revised bumper covers and side skirts in comparison with the contemporary Carrera

listings.bat_location: United States View all listings Notify me about new listings This 2025 Porsche is #1
listings.bat_description: This 2025 Porsche is #1,353 of 1,974 911 Turbo 50 Years examples produced worldwide, all of which link a Turbo S-specification twin-turbocharged 3.7L flat-six with an eight-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle and all-wheel drive. This example is finished in paint-to-sample Aetna Blue over black leather and Tartan fabric upholstery and is equipped with the Heritage Design Package, a sunroof, LED-Matrix Design headlights with PDLS+, Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, 20″ and 21″ Sport Classic wheels, a front-axle lift system, a sport exhaust system, Lane Change Assist, heated power-adjustable front seats, a surround-view camera system, a Burmester sound system, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation. Purchased new by the owner, this 992.1 Turbo 50 Years has 17 miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner in Arizona with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, two keys, accessories, a clean Carfax report, and a Montana title in the name of the owner’s LLC

listings.bat_description: This 2024 Porsche 911 GT3 was purchased new by the owner and was optioned from the factory with an Arctic Gray exterior finish in addition to Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) and a six-speed manual transaxle, which is paired with a 4.0-liter flat-six. Having just over 2k miles, it is further equipped with a mechanical limited-slip differential, black leather and Race-Tex upholstery, LED headlights, a rear swan-neck-hinged wing, rear-axle steering, Satin Neodyme 20″ and 21″ center-locking wheels, a front-axle lift system, heated 18-way adaptive Sport Plus seats, a Bose sound system, and Porsche Communication Management. This 992 GT3 is now offered on dealer consignment with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Alabama title.The car is finished in Arctic Gray and has LED headlights, a rear swan-neck-hinged wing, a rear fog light, ParkAssist rear parking sensors, a backup camera, puddle light projectors, side graphics, and dual center-exit exhaus

listings.bat_description: This 2022 Porsche 911 Targa 4S was specified from the factory with Shark Blue paint in addition to the Sport Chrono, SportDesign, and Premium packages and was delivered new to Porsche Irvine in California. Power comes from a twin-turbocharged 3.0L flat-six that drives all four wheels through an eight-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle, and the car rolls on staggered-diameter Carrera Exclusive Manufaktur wheels. Further equipment includes a power-operated black targa top, a front axle lift system, a black targa bar, and a sport exhaust system. Inside, the heated, ventilated, and power-adjustable Adaptive Sport front seats are trimmed in black leather and are accompanied by a Bose surround sound system, dual-zone automatic climate control, and Porsche Communication Management infotainment. Acquired by its current owneron BaT in April 2023, this 992 Targa has 2,900 miles and is now offered on dealer consignment with manufacturer’s literature, two fob keys, a clean Carfax report, an

listings.bat_description: This 2004 Porsche 911 Turbo cabriolet was purchased by the selleron BaT in December 2021and now has 72k miles. The car is finished in black over black leather and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.6L flat-six that drives all four wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle. Features include the Power Plus Package, the Heated Front Seats Package, the Large Aluminum-Look Interior Package, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a power-operated black soft top, a removable hardtop, xenon headlights, integrated fog lights, 18″ Forgestar F14 wheels, navigation, drilled metal pedals, and automatic climate control. This 996 Turbo cabriolet is now offered with the owner’s manual, a hardtop stand, a clean Carfax report, and an Alberta registration in the seller’s name.The car is finished in Black (041) with a matching convertible soft top and a removable hardtop. Additional equipment includes xenon headlights, stainless-steel exhaust outlets, fog lights, and a speed-activated rear spoiler, as well as wid

listings.bat_location: an adjustable rear wing, an
listings.bat_description: This 2010 Porsche 911 GT3 has 10k miles and was previously owned by Porsche collector Rudy “Mr. 993″ Mancinas. It has been fitted with carbon-fiber bucket seats, body-color interior trim components, and a Shark Werks exhaust system, and it is powered by a 3.8-liter flat-six linked with a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. Finished in Guards Red over black leather upholstery, the car is further equipped with the Sound Package Plus, silver 19″ center-locking wheels, bi-xenon headlights, an adjustable rear wing, and automatic climate control. This 997.2 GT3 was purchased by the owner in 2020 and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner in New Jersey with a clean Carfax report and a clean Florida title in the owner’s name.The 997.2 GT3 is distinguished from contemporary 911 Carrera models by its more aggressive front and rear fascias, an adjustable rear wing, and a center-exit sports exhaust system. This example is finished in Guards Red and has bi-xenon

listings.bat_location: service records, to
listings.bat_description: This 2018 Porsche 911 Carrera GTS coupe was ordered with nearly $31k in options, including Burmester audio, Adaptive Sport Seats Plus, a glass sunroof, a front-axle lift system, rear-axle steering, the Premium Package Plus, and LED headlights with PDLS+. It is finished in Carrara White Metallic over a Black leather interior and is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.0L flat-six paired with a seven-speed PDK transaxle. The seller purchased the car in 2021 and has since added approximately 20k of the 44k indicated miles. This 991.2 GTS coupe is now offered with a window sticker, service records, tools, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.The GTS features wider bodywork than the standard Carrera as well as a front lower lip spoiler, side skirts, SportDesign side mirrors, and a revised front apron. This example is finished in Carrara White Metallic and equipped with LED headlights with the Porsche Dynamic Light System Plus (PDLS+) as well as a glass sunroo

listings.bat_description: Aug 13 at 11:31 AMJack-PorscheThis author's likes:5,257@remingtonsr71I won’t argue the points you have made, but you can’t compare the brand loyalty and following of Porsche to Alfa and McLaren on a global scale.Also, I think you answered your own question. To most who are buying these hand built bespoke resto mods, the money doesn’t really matter. I also think you are overthinking the carbon factor. People aren’t paying 7 figures for a Singer because of the carbon.Your thoughts remind me of the watch collectors who constantly argue that other brands have better finish and value than Rolex, yet Rolex has the biggest following.Stop trying to make dollars and “cents” of it. It’s Porsche!CancelYour changes are being saved.This comment's likes:0This comment's likes:0This comment's likes:0Flag as not constructiveFlag as not constructiveFlagged as not constructive — Thanks.EditAug 13 at 4:28 AMfattychargedThis author's likes:376@RemingtonSR71nailed it…absolute nutteryCancelYour changes are b

listings.bat_location: Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS)
listings.bat_description: This 2009 Porsche 911 Carrera S coupe was purchased by the selleron BaT in November 2022. It is powered by a 3.8-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle and is finished in Guards Red over black leather. Equipment includes the Sport Chrono Plus Package, Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS), a Sport exhaust system, a Fabspeed X-pipe, 19″ Sport Classic wheels, a deployable rear spoiler, clear taillights, a sunroof, PCM with navigation, a Bose High-End sound system, heated front seats, automatic climate control, and cruise control. The car was sold new at Jack Daniels Porsche in Nanuet, New York, and has 45k miles. This 997.2 Carrera S coupe is now offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, a Porsche Certificate of Authenticity, removed parts, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Tennessee title in the seller’s name.The car is finished in Guards Red and features bi-xenon headlights with PDLS, fog lights, clear taillights, rain-sensing windshield wip

listings.bat_location: Log
listings.bat_description: This 1999 Porsche 911 Carrera 4 coupe is finished in Ocean Blue Metallic over gray leather and is powered by a 3.4-liter M96 flat-six that drives all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes aftermarket headers, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a sunroof, a Turbonite front emblem, and 18″ Turbo-look wheels. The car also has an Apple CarPlay-compatible head unit, a Bose subwoofer, and a rearview camera. The front seats were reupholstered under current ownership, and additional work included replacing the sunroof motor, headlights, brake pads and rotors, left window regulator, fan resistors, battery, and engine mounts. Acquired by the seller in 2023, this 996 C4 coupe has 95k miles and is now offered at no reserve with an owner’s manual, an Autocheck report, a Carfax report, and a clean Georgia title in the seller’s name.The car is finished in Ocean Blue Metallic (6A6) and features a sunroof, a speed-activated rear spoiler, integrated fog lights, heated mirrors
